remarks.format: ## Remarks Thickness is relative to the geometry of the shape associated with this pen.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Pen Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Pen CloneCurrentValue() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: To be added.
Gets or sets a value that specifies how the ends of each dash are drawn.
Docs.value:
Specifies how the ends of each dash are drawn.
This setting applies to both ends of each dash. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty DashCapProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.DashCap%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that describes the pattern of dashes generated by this .
Docs.value: A value that describes the pattern of dashes generated by this . The default is <xref:System.Windows.Media.DashStyles.Solid%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, which indicates that there should be no dashes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The class provides a set of predefined dash patterns. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to use the property of a to create a dashed line under text. [!code-xml[DrawingMiscSnippets_snip#DashStyle](~/add/codesnippet/Xaml/DrawingMiscSnippets_snip.misc_snippets/DashStyleExample.xaml#dashstyle)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty DashStyleProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.DashStyle%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the type of shape to use at the end of a stroke.
Docs.value: The type of shape that ends the stroke. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to use the and EndLineCap properties to create a rounded end on one side of a stroke and a triangular end on the other side of the stroke. [!code-xml[DrawingMiscSnippets_snip#PenStartEndLineCapWholePage](~/add/codesnippet/Xaml/DrawingMiscSnippets_snip.misc_snippets/PenStartEndLineCapExample.xaml#penstartendlinecapwholepage)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty EndLineCapProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.EndLineCap%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the type of joint used at the vertices of a shape's outline.
Docs.value: The type of joint used at the vertices of a shape's outline. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty LineJoinProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.LineJoin%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the limit on the ratio of the miter length to half this pen's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness%2A>.
Docs.value: The limit on the ratio of the miter length to half the pen's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness%2A>. This value is always a positive number greater than or equal to 1. The default value is 10.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A miter is a joint made by beveling each of two surfaces to be joined to form a corner. When two line segments meet at a sharp angle, the miter may extend beyond the thickness of the line that strokes the path. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to use the MiterLimit property to limit the size of a corner created by two line segments. [!code-xml[DrawingMiscSnippets_snip#PenMiterLimitExampleWholePage](~/add/codesnippet/Xaml/DrawingMiscSnippets_snip.misc_snippets/PenMiterLimitExample.xaml#penmiterlimitexamplewholepage)] The following illustration shows what this code example produces. ![Shows MiterLimit example. Corner formed is cut.](~/add/media/graphicsmiterlimit.png "Shows MiterLimit example. Corner formed is cut.")

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty MiterLimitProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.MiterLimit%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the type of shape to use at the beginning of a stroke.
Docs.value: The type of shape that starts the stroke. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to use the StartLineCap and properties to create a rounded end on one side of a stroke and a triangular end on the other side of the stroke. [!code-xml[DrawingMiscSnippets_snip#PenStartEndLineCapWholePage](~/add/codesnippet/Xaml/DrawingMiscSnippets_snip.misc_snippets/PenStartEndLineCapExample.xaml#penstartendlinecapwholepage)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty StartLineCapProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.StartLineCap%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the thickness of the stroke produced by this .
Docs.value: The thickness of the stroke produced by this . Default is `1`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Thickness is relative to the geometry of the shape associated with this pen. Negative values are treated as though they were positive. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
